channel.title: What Kind of Enviroment?
channel.description:
I have never used Linux before. I have recently purchased Windows Vista Home Premium but it is not as good as I thought it would it be. Windows XP is fine for me but I have always wanted to change to Linux and now is probably the time to.
What kind of eviroment is more user friendly to a new person using Linux? by that I mean KDE or GNOME.
And what has a better look and feel.

item.title: What Kind of Enviroment?
item.dc:creator: @Braille Braille
item.description:
@Braille wrote:

Yeah you can for example in debian distros just apt-get yourself a new environment and install it just as easily, the power of Linux.

Read full topic

item.title: What Kind of Enviroment?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

sppt:

also, linus once said he hated gnome, mopar showed it to me once

Yeah I read that article too. But the only reason he switched was because the gnome project wouldn’t except his very simple code and the kde project did. And just because linus switched, doesn’t mean everyone else has to. I use gnome because I like things simple. Sure I could use kde, but what for. I don’t need eye candy other than beryl which is more than enough, so kde doesn’t appeal to me.

Best way to pick a desktop environment is to try all of them. You can always uninstall them, it’s no big deal and you don’t always have to pick one. You can install both gnome and kde and get them to work. I had both of them installed once to try both out and you can select which environment you want at the login screen.

Read full topic

item.title: What Kind of Enviroment?
item.dc:creator: @Braille Braille
item.description:
@Braille wrote:

Gnome for normal to advanced but still nice looking environment, KDE if you don’t mind wading through 8000 configs to get what you want. Although as KDE say, everyone wants something different from the desktop and thats what they offer. Or XFCE if you want best out of your computer.

Read full topic

item.title: What Kind of Enviroment?
item.dc:creator: @Painless Painless
item.description:
@Painless wrote:

[quote=“sppt, post:5, topic:121658”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=171262.msg1584821#msg1584821 date=1184113575]
Personally I like KDE much better than anything else I have tried (gnome, xfce, fluxbox, wmii) It was also an easy transition from windows to kubuntu.
[/quote]
+1

also, linus once said he hated gnome, mopar showed it to me once :p[/quote]

Yes but who would obviously listen to such a person? :rolleyes:
I use Gnome. I like it better. But default gnome isn’t that great. Don’t like the colours.

Read full topic

item.title: What Kind of Enviroment?
item.dc:creator: @The_Wise_Guy .Kaboom
item.description:
@The_Wise_Guy wrote:

[quote=“http://www.psychocats.net/essays/kdevsgnome”]What Gnome and KDE have in common
A lot of people say that KDE is more Windows-like, but I have no clue what this means. Sure, it has something like a Start Menu, and it has a taskbar, but so does Gnome. They both have desktops that can have icons. They both can have launchers and window lists for multi-tasking. They both have screensavers and theme options. In general, they’re essentially the same for day-to-day functioning. If I’m in Gnome, and I want to launch an application, I click on the icon to launch the application or use a keyboard shortcut to launch it–same thing in KDE, though. They both have clocks (or can have clocks) on the taskbar/panel, and they both have themeable log-in screens. The theming part is important to take note of because if someone tells you Gnome or KDE “looks” a certain way, it doesn’t matter. You can always go to KDE-look or Gnome-look and download and install a new theme to change the appearance of your windows, your icons, and your login screen. I have both my Gnome and KDE desktops looking “aqua” in a Mac style with Mac-like icons.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: What Kind of Enviroment?
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

Moparisthebest:

You can change all the colors and just about everything else. I prefer the plastique theme with KDE.

the plastik theme is indeed the best, the one that’s selected in kubuntu by default just smells like vista

item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

I personally prefer Gnome, KDE tends to have random things I don’t need/want.

Asking which environment is better is futile, peoples opinions differ too greatly. I would suggest getting both and trying them each for a few hours.
